subject: Discussion on System Design Tradeoffs
body: Hey, I was thinking about the tradeoffs in system design. For scalability, we often sacrifice consistency. What do you think?

thread.body: Hey, I was thinking about the tradeoffs in system design. For scalability, we often sacrifice consistency. What do you think?
Yes, that's a classic CAP theorem issue. In distributed systems, you can't have all three: consistency, availability, partition tolerance.

subject: Book Recommendations
body: Check out 'Designing Data-Intensive Applications'. Great for understanding tradeoffs in databases.

thread.body: Check out 'Designing Data-Intensive Applications'. Great for understanding tradeoffs in databases.
